etymologies: mid 17th century: related to crib; the game is said to have been invented by the English poet Sir John Suckling; it seems to have been developed from an older game called Noddy

definitions: a card game for two to four players, in which the objective is to play so that the value of one's cards played reaches exactly 15 or 31.
shortDefinitions: card game in which objective is to play so that pip value of one's cards played reaches exactly 15 or 31
